name: Clin T Corpus Carcinoma
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** When both FIGO stage and extension detail are available, record the code with extension detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage.

**Note 2:** To assign a T2 category, stromal connective tissue of the cervix must be involved; endocervical glandular involvement only is not considered a T2 tumor in TNM. 

**Note 3:** FIGO IIIA and IIIB are extension, whereas FIGO IIIC is nodal involvement.  FIGO IVA is extension, whereas FIGO IVB is distant metastasis. FIGO Stage III, NOS and FIGO Stage IV, NOS are assigned based on tumor extension and/or metastasis.  Code primary tumor based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage III, NOS or FIGO Stage IV, NOS only if it is known that the stage value is assigned because of tumor extension.

**Note 4:**  Extension to the bowel or bladder mucosa must be proven by biopsy in order to rule out bullous edema.
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Intraepithelial, noninvasive, preinvasive

Stated as Tis
Tumor confined to the corpus uteri

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Invasive cancer confined to corpus uteri 
Invasion of myometrium, NOS

Endocervical glandular involvement WITH tumor invading myometrium, NOS or involvement of myometrium not known

Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Tumor limited to endometrium or invading less than half of myometrium

Confined to endometrium (stroma)

Tumor invades less than one-half of myometrium invasion of inner half of myometrium

Endocervical glandular involvement WITH tumor limited to endometrium or invading less than one-half of myometrium

FIGO Stage IA

Stated as T1a
Tumor invades one half or more of myometrium

Tumor invades one-half or more of myometrium Invasion of outer half of myometrium

Endocervical glandular involvement WITH tumor invading one-half or more of myometrium

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b
Tumor invades cervical stroma, but does not extend beyond the uterus

Cervix uteri, NOS, but not beyond uterus
Cervical stromal invasion

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2
Local and/or regional spread as specified below

Note: T3 has subcategories of T3a and T3b. Assign T3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

FIGO Stage III [NOS]

Stated as T3 [NOS]

Tumor invades the serosa of the corpus uteri or adnexae 
    (direct extension or metastasis)

Extension or metastasis to  
    Tunica serosa (visceral peritoneum of corpus, serosa covering the corpus) 
    Tunica serosa of corpus
    WITHOUT involvement of cervix

Extension or metastasis to:
    Adnexa:
    Fallopian tube(s)
    Ovary(ies)

FIGO Stage IIIA

Stated as T3a

Vaginal or parametrial involvement 
    (direct extension or metastasis)

Extension or metastasis to:
    Bladder wall
    Bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
    Ligaments:
        Broad
        Round
    Parametrium, NOS
    Parietal serosa of pelvic wall
    Pelvic wall(s)
    Rectal wall
    Rectum, NOS excluding mucosa
    Vagina
    Visceral peritoneum of pelvic organs excluding serosa of corpus

Extension to:
   Ureter 
   Vulva
    
Described clinically as "frozen pelvis", NOS

FIGO Stage IIIB

Stated as T3b

Extension to bowel mucosa or bladder mucosa (excluding bullous edema)

Further contiguous extension
    Abdominal serosa (visceral or parietal peritoneum of abdomen)
    Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch or Pouch of Douglas)
    Sigmoid colon
    Small intestine

FIGO Stage IVA 
FIGO Stage IV [NOS] based on extension

Stated as T4
